symbols.name: sap.fe.core.AppComponent
symbols.description:
Main class for components used for an application in SAP Fiori elements.
Application developers using the templates and building blocks provided by SAP Fiori elements should create their apps by extending this component. This ensures that all the necessary services that you need for the building blocks and templates to work properly are started.
When you use sap.fe.core.AppComponent as the base component, you also need to use a rootView. SAP Fiori elements provides two options:
- sap.fe.core.rootView.NavContainer when using sap.m.routing.Router
- sap.fe.core.rootView.Fcl when using sap.f.routing.Router (FCL use case)

methods.name: changePageConfiguration

parameters.name: pageId
parameters.description: The ID of the page for which the configuration is to be changed.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path in the page settings for which the configuration is to be changed.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The new value of the configuration. This could be a plain value like a string, or a Boolean, or a structured object.

methods.description:
Changes the page configuration of SAP Fiori elements.
This method enables you to change the page configuration of SAP Fiori elements.

methods.name: initializeFeatureToggles

returnValue.description: A promise without any value to allow asynchronous processes

methods.description:
Provides a hook to initialize feature toggles.
This hook is being called by the SAP Fiori elements AppComponent at the time feature toggles can be initialized. To change page configuration use the {@link sap.fe.core.AppComponent#changePageConfiguration } method.

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.BaseController
symbols.description:
Internal base controller class for SAP Fiori elements application.
If you want to extend a base controller for your custom page, please use for sap.fe.core.PageController.

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.ExtensionAPI
symbols.description:
Common Extension API for all pages of SAP Fiori elements for OData V4.
To correctly integrate your app extension coding with SAP Fiori elements, use only the extensionAPI of SAP Fiori elements. Don't access or manipulate controls, properties, models, or other internal objects created by the SAP Fiori elements framework.

properties.name: editFlow
properties.description: A controller extension offering hooks into the edit flow of the application.

properties.name: routing
properties.description: A controller extension offering hooks into the routing flow of the application.

methods.name: getModel

returnValue.description: The required model

parameters.name: sModelName
parameters.description: Name of the model

methods.description:
Get access to models managed by SAP Fiori elements.
The following models can be accessed:
  • undefined: the undefined model returns the SAPUI5 OData V4 model bound to this page
  • i18n / further data models defined in the manifest
  • ui: returns a SAPUI5 JSON model containing UI information. Only the following properties are public and supported:
    • isEditable: set to true if the application is in edit mode
. editMode is deprecated and should not be used anymore. Use isEditable instead.

symbols.name: sap.fe
symbols.description: Root namespace for all the libraries related to SAP Fiori elements.

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.PageController

Base controller class for your custom page used inside an SAP Fiori elements application.
This controller provides preconfigured extensions that will ensure you have the basic functionalities required to use the building blocks.

creationMode.name: creationMode
creationMode.description:
The creation mode using one of the following:
NewPage - the created document is shown in a new page, depending on whether metadata 'Sync', 'Async' or 'Deferred' is used
Inline - The creation is done inline (in a table)
External - The creation is done in a different application specified via the parameter 'outbound'

data.description: The initial data for the created document

outbound.name: outbound
outbound.description: The navigation target where the document is created in case of creationMode 'External'

selectedContexts.description: The contexts that are selected in the table initiating the creation. Used in case of a TreeTable to determine the parent context of the created document

invocationGrouping.description: Mode how actions are to be called: 'ChangeSet' to put all action calls into one changeset, 'Isolated' to put them into separate changesets

label.name: label
label.description: A human-readable label for the action. This is needed in case the action has a parameter and a parameter dialog is shown to the user. The label will be used for the title of the dialog and for the confirmation button

model.name: model
model.description: For an unbound action, an instance of an OData V4 model must be provided

parameterValues.name: parameterValues
parameterValues.description: A map of action parameter names and provided values

requiresNavigation.name: requiresNavigation
requiresNavigation.description: Boolean value indicating whether navigation is required after the action has been executed. Navigation takes place to the context returned by the action

skipParameterDialog.name: skipParameterDialog
skipParameterDialog.description: Skips the action parameter dialog if values are provided for all of them in parameterValues

parameters.description: Contains the following attributes:

methods.description: Invokes an action (bound or unbound) and tracks the changes so that other pages can be refreshed and show the updated data upon navigation.

methods.name: onBeforeCreate

returnValue.description: A promise to be returned by the overridden method. If resolved, the 'Create' action is triggered. If rejected, the 'Create' action is not triggered.

parameters.name: _mParameters

contextPath.name: contextPath
contextPath.description: Path pointing to the context on which Create action is triggered

createParameters.name: createParameters
createParameters.description: Array of values that are filled in the Action Parameter Dialog

parameters.description: Object containing the parameters passed to onBeforeCreate

methods.description:
This function can be used to intercept the 'Create' action. You can execute custom coding in this function. The framework waits for the returned promise to be resolved before continuing the 'Create' action. If you reject the promise, the 'Create' action is stopped.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: {@link sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After }.

This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: {@link sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After }.

updatesDocument.name: updatesDocument
updatesDocument.description: This operation updates the current document without using the bound model and context. As a result, the draft status is updated if a draft document exists, and the user has to confirm the cancellation of the editing process.

parameters.description: Definitions of the preconditions to be checked before execution

methods.description: Secured execution of the given function. Ensures that the function is only executed when certain conditions are fulfilled.

methods.name: updateDocument

returnValue.description: Promise resolves once draft status has been updated

parameters.name: updatedContext
parameters.description: Context of the updated field

parameters.name: updatePromise
parameters.description: Promise to determine when the update operation is completed. The promise should be resolved when the update operation is completed, so the draft status can be updated.

methods.description: Updates the draft status and displays the error messages if there are errors during an update.

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.controllerextensions.IntentBasedNavigation
symbols.description: Controller extension providing hooks for intent-based navigation

methods.name: adaptNavigationContext

parameters.name: _oSelectionVariant
parameters.description: SelectionVariant provided by SAP Fiori elements.

parameters.name: _oNavigationInfo

semanticObject.name: semanticObject
semanticObject.description: Semantic object related to the intent

parameters.description: Object containing intent-based navigation-related info

methods.description: Provides a hook to customize the {@link sap.fe.navigation.SelectionVariant } related to the intent-based navigation.

methods.name: navigateOutbound

parameters.name: sOutbound
parameters.description:
Identifier to locate the outbound definition in the manifest.
This provides the semantic object and action for the intent-based navigation.
Additionally, the outbound definition can be used to provide parameters for intent-based navigation.
See {@link topic :be0cf40f61184b358b5faedaec98b2da Descriptor for Applications, Components, and Libraries} for more information.

parameters.name: mNavigationParameters
parameters.description:
Optional map containing key/value pairs to be passed to the intent.
If mNavigationParameters are provided, the parameters provided in the outbound definition of the manifest are ignored.

methods.description: Navigates to an intent defined by an outbound definition in the manifest.

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.controllerextensions.MessageHandler
symbols.description: A controller extension offering message handling.

methods.name: showMessageDialog

returnValue.description:
A promise that is resolved once the user closes the dialog. If there are no messages
to be shown, the promise is resolved immediately

methods.description:
Shows a message dialog with transition messages if there are any.
The message dialog is shown as a modal dialog. Once the user confirms the dialog, all transition messages
are removed from the message model. If there is more than one message, a list of messages is shown. The user
can filter on message types and can display details as well as the long text. If there is one message,
the dialog immediately shows the details of the message. If there is just one success message, a message
toast is shown instead.

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.controllerextensions.Routing
symbols.description: A controller extension offering hooks into the routing flow of the application

methods.name: navigate

parameters.name: oContext
parameters.description: Object containing the context to be navigated to

methods.description: Allows navigation to a specific context.

methods.name: navigateToRoute

returnValue.description: Promise that is resolved when the navigation is finalized

parameters.name: sTargetRouteName
parameters.description: Name of the target route

parameters.name: oParameters
parameters.description: Parameters to be used with route to create the target hash

methods.description: Navigate to another target.

methods.name: onAfterBinding

parameters.name: oContext
parameters.description: Object containing the context to be navigated

methods.description:
This function is used to intercept the routing event after binding a page.
If it is declared as an extension, it allows you to intercept and change the normal flow of binding.
This function is not called directly, but overridden separately by consuming controllers. The override execution is: {@link sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After }.

methods.name: onBeforeBinding

parameters.name: oContext
parameters.description: Object containing the context for the navigation

methods.description:
This function is used to intercept the routing event before binding a page.
If it is declared as an extension, it allows you to intercept and change the normal flow of binding.
This function is not called directly, but overridden separately by consuming controllers. The override execution is: {@link sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After }.

methods.name: onBeforeNavigation

returnValue.description: `true` to prevent the default execution, false to keep the standard behavior

parameters.name: mNavigationParameters
parameters.description: Object containing row context and page context

methods.description:
This function can be used to intercept the routing event happening during the normal process of navigating from one page to another (like clicking on the table row to navigate, or when pagination buttons are clicked).
The function is NOT called during other means of external outbound navigation (like a navigation configured via a link, or by using navigation buttons).
If declared as an extension, it allows you to intercept and change the normal navigation flow. If you decide to do your own navigation processing, you can return `true` to prevent the default routing behavior.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: {@link sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After }.

A controller extension offering hooks for state handling
If you need to maintain a specific state for your application, you can use the controller extension.

Important: You should only override this method for custom pages and not for the standard ListReportPage and ObjectPage!

parameters.name: skipMerge
parameters.description: Boolean which determines to skip the key user shine through

methods.description: Applies the given view state to this extensions view.

methods.name: onAfterStateApplied

parameters.name: aPromises
parameters.description: Extensible array of promises to be resolved before continuing

methods.description:
Hook to react when state for given view was applied.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: {@link sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After }.

methods.name: onBeforeStateApplied

parameters.name: aPromises
parameters.description: Extensible array of promises to be resolved before continuing

parameters.name: navigationType
parameters.description: Navigation type responsible for the applying the state

methods.description:
Hook to react before a state for given view is applied.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: {@link sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After }.

methods.name: onRestore
methods.description: Called when the application is restored due to keep-alive mode.

methods.name: onSuspend
methods.description: Called when the application is suspended due to keep-alive mode.

methods.name: retrieveAdditionalStates

parameters.name: mAdditionalStates
parameters.description: The additional state

methods.description:
Extend the map of additional states (not control bound) to be added to the current view state of the given view.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: {@link sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After }.

methods.name: retrieveViewState

returnValue.description: A promise resolving the view state

methods.description: Retrieve the view state of this extensions view. When this function is called more than once before finishing, all but the final response will resolve to undefined.

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.controllerextensions.ViewState.NavigationParameter
symbols.description: Definition of a custom action to be used inside the table toolbar

properties.name: requiresStandardVariant
properties.description: Defines whether the standard variant must be used in variant management

properties.name: selectionVariantDefaults
properties.description: The selectionVariant defaults from the navigation

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.fpm.Component

properties.name: viewName
properties.description: Name of the XML view which is used for this page. The XML view can contain SAP Fiori elements Building Blocks and XML template constructions.

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.rootView.Fcl
symbols.description:
Base controller class for your own root view with an sap.f.FlexibleColumnLayout control.
By using or extending this controller, you can use your own root view with the sap.fe.core.AppComponent and you can make use of SAP Fiori elements pages and SAP Fiori elements building blocks.

methods.name: displayErrorPage

returnValue.description: A promise that creates a Page to display the error

methods.description: Method that creates a new Page to display the IllustratedMessage containing the current error.

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.rootView.NavContainer
symbols.description:
Base controller class for your own root view with a sap.m.NavContainer control.
By using or extending this controller you can use your own root view with the sap.fe.core.AppComponent and you can make use of SAP Fiori elements pages and SAP Fiori elements building blocks.

methods.name: displayErrorPage

returnValue.description: A promise that creates a Page to display the error

methods.description: Method that creates a new Page to display the IllustratedMessage containing the current error.
